title: Write Ratios to Describe Relationships
description: Learn to write ratios comparing two quantities

questions.question: A bag has 3 red and 5 blue marbles. What is the ratio of red to blue?
questions.hint: Ratio of A to B is written A:B

questions.question: There are 12 boys and 8 girls in a class. What is the ratio of boys to girls?
questions.hint: Put the first quantity mentioned before the colon

questions.question: A recipe uses 2 cups flour and 1 cup sugar. What is the ratio of flour to sugar?
questions.hint: Write flour amount first, then sugar amount

questions.question: A garden has 15 roses and 10 tulips. What is the ratio of tulips to roses?
questions.hint: Tulips are mentioned first in the question

questions.question: Which ratio represents 4 cats to 7 dogs?
In a parking lot, there are 20 cars and 5 motorcycles. What is the ratio of motorcycles to cars?
A fruit bowl has 6 apples, 4 oranges, and 2 bananas. What is the ratio of apples to oranges?
questions.hint: Only compare apples and oranges, ignore bananas

questions.question: There are 9 fiction books and 3 non-fiction books. What is the ratio of fiction to non-fiction?
A team won 7 games and lost 3 games. What is the ratio of wins to losses?
In a bag of candy, there are 8 red and 12 green candies. What is the ratio of red to total?
A necklace has 5 gold beads for every 2 silver beads. Write this ratio.

title: Simplify Ratios
description: Reduce ratios to their simplest form

questions.question: Simplify the ratio 8:12
questions.hint: Divide both numbers by their GCF (4)

questions.question: Simplify the ratio 10:10
questions.hint: When both numbers are equal, the simplest form is 1:1

questions.question: Which ratio is equivalent to 6:9 in simplest form?

title: Identify Equivalent Ratios
description: Find ratios that represent the same relationship

questions.question: Which ratio is NOT equivalent to 3:4?
questions.hint: Check if each ratio simplifies to 3:4

questions.question: Which pair of ratios are equivalent?
questions.hint: Check which pair has the same simplified form

title: Use Ratio Tables
description: Complete and analyze ratio tables

questions.question: In a ratio table, if 2:5 becomes 4:10, what comes next?
questions.hint: Add 2 to the first value and 5 to the second

questions.question: A table shows cups of flour to eggs: 3:2, 6:4, 9:?

title: Solve Ratio Word Problems
description: Apply ratios to real-world situations

questions.question: The ratio of cats to dogs at a shelter is 3:5. If there are 15 cats, how many dogs are there?
A recipe uses sugar and flour in a 2:5 ratio. If you use 10 cups of flour, how much sugar?
Boys and girls are in a 4:3 ratio. If there are 28 boys, how many girls?
Red and blue marbles are in a 5:2 ratio. If there are 35 total, how many are red?
A map scale is 1:50. If a road is 3 cm on the map, how long is it in real life?
Orange juice to water is 1:4. To make 15 cups total, how much water?
The ratio of adults to children is 2:7. If there are 63 people total, how many adults?
A trail mix has nuts to raisins in a 3:2 ratio. With 12 cups of nuts, how many cups of raisins?
Pencils and pens are in a 5:3 ratio. If there are 40 pencils, how many pens?
A solution has acid to water in a 1:9 ratio. In 500 mL of solution, how much is acid?
Teachers to students ratio is 1:15. With 8 teachers, how many students?

title: Understand Proportions
description: Learn what proportions are and how to identify them

questions.question: Which shows a proportion?
questions.hint: A proportion means two ratios are equal

questions.question: Which pair forms a proportion?
questions.hint: Check if they simplify to the same fraction

questions.question: Which does NOT form a proportion with 2/7?
questions.hint: All except one are equivalent to 2/7

questions.question: Which pair does NOT form a proportion?

title: Solve Proportions
description: Find missing values in proportions using cross multiplication

title: Proportion Word Problems
description: Apply proportions to solve real-world problems

questions.question: If 3 apples cost $2, how much do 12 apples cost?
A car travels 150 miles in 3 hours. How far in 5 hours at the same speed?
If 5 workers finish a job in 8 days, how long for 10 workers?
A recipe for 4 serves uses 6 eggs. How many eggs for 10 servings?
On a map, 2 cm = 50 km. How far is 7 cm in real distance?
If 8 pencils cost $6, how many pencils can you buy with $15?
A machine makes 240 parts in 6 hours. How many in 10 hours?
If 12 gallons fill 2/3 of a tank, how many gallons fill the whole tank?
A shadow is 8 feet when a 6-foot person stands. What's the shadow of a 9-foot tree?
If 15 books weigh 24 pounds, how much do 25 books weigh?

title: Understand Rates
description: Learn to identify and write rates

questions.question: What is a rate?
questions.hint: Rates compare quantities with different units

questions.question: Which is a rate?
questions.hint: Rates have different units (dollars and hours)

questions.question: A car travels 240 miles in 4 hours. What is the rate?
If you earn $45 for 5 hours of work, what is your rate of pay?
A printer prints 120 pages in 10 minutes. What is the rate?
A faucet drips 24 drops in 4 minutes. What is the rate?
You read 150 pages in 3 days. What is your reading rate?
A recipe uses 2 cups sugar for 8 cookies. What is the rate?
Which unit describes a speed rate?

title: Calculate Unit Rates
description: Find rates per one unit

questions.question: Find the unit rate: $24 for 6 items
Find the unit rate: 350 miles in 7 hours
Find the unit rate: 180 words in 3 minutes
Find the unit rate: $13.50 for 3 pounds
Find the unit rate: 45 students in 3 classes
Find the unit rate: 72 heartbeats in 60 seconds
Find the unit rate: $36 for 8 gallons of gas
Find the unit rate: 156 miles on 6 gallons
Find the unit rate: 420 calories in 3 servings
Find the unit rate: $84 for 12 tickets
Find the unit rate: 250 meters in 50 seconds

title: Compare Unit Rates
description: Use unit rates to compare and make decisions

questions.question: Which is the better buy: 3 for $6 or 5 for $9?
Car A: 280 miles on 8 gallons. Car B: 240 miles on 6 gallons. Which is more efficient?
Store X: 12 oz for $4.80. Store Y: 16 oz for $6.08. Which is cheaper per ounce?
Runner A: 2 miles in 16 min. Runner B: 3 miles in 21 min. Who is faster?
questions.hint: A: 16÷2=8 min/mile. B: 21÷3=7 min/mile (lower is faster)

questions.question: Job A: $72 for 8 hours. Job B: $85 for 10 hours. Which pays more per hour?
Pack A: 24 pencils for $6. Pack B: 36 pencils for $8. Which is the better value?
Machine A: 150 items in 5 min. Machine B: 240 items in 8 min. Which is faster?
Plan A: 5 GB for $25. Plan B: 8 GB for $36. Which has better price per GB?
Pool A fills at 120 gallons in 4 min. Pool B at 200 gallons in 8 min. Which fills faster?
Brand X: 18 oz cereal for $5.40. Brand Y: 24 oz for $6.48. Better deal?

title: Rate Word Problems
description: Solve real-world problems using rates

questions.question: A car travels 55 mph. How far does it go in 4 hours?
At $12 per hour, how much do you earn in 7.5 hours?
A faucet leaks 2 gallons per day. How much in 2 weeks?
You type 45 words per minute. How many words in 8 minutes?
Gas costs $4.25 per gallon. How much for 12 gallons?
A plane flies 500 mph. How long to fly 2,000 miles?
You earn $56 in 7 hours. At this rate, how much in 12 hours?
A factory makes 180 widgets per hour. How many in a 9-hour shift?
Water flows at 15 liters per minute. How long to fill a 450-liter tank?
A recipe needs 3 cups flour for 24 cookies. How much flour for 40 cookies?

title: Convert Rates Between Units
description: Change rates from one unit to another

questions.question: Convert 60 miles per hour to miles per minute.
Convert $720 per month to dollars per week (4 weeks/month).
Convert 12 feet per second to feet per minute.
Convert 24 gallons per day to gallons per hour.
Convert 300 words per minute to words per hour.
Convert $15 per hour to dollars per 8-hour day.
Convert 90 km per hour to km per minute.
Convert 365 pages per week to pages per day.
Convert 480 beats per minute to beats per second.
Convert 5 meters per second to meters per minute.

title: Understand Percent
description: Learn what percent means and basic conversions

title: Find Percent of a Number
description: Calculate a percentage of a given number

title: Find the Whole Given a Percent
description: Work backwards from a percent to find the original number

title: Find What Percent One Number Is of Another
description: Calculate what percentage one number is of another

title: Percent Increase and Decrease
description: Calculate percent change between values

questions.question: A price increased from $40 to $50. What is the percent increase?
A number decreased from 80 to 60. What is the percent decrease?
If a $60 item is marked 20% off, what is the sale price?
A population grew from 200 to 250. What is the percent increase?
A $80 jacket is on sale for 15% off. What is the sale price?
After a 10% increase, a number is 55. What was the original?
A $25 item with 8% tax. What is the total cost?
Stock dropped from $50 to $40. What is the percent decrease?
A worker got a 5% raise on $400/week. What is the new pay?
After a 20% discount, a shirt costs $24. What was the original price?

title: Percent Word Problems
description: Apply percent concepts to real-world situations

questions.question: A test has 40 questions. You got 32 correct. What percent?
A store has 25% off. A $60 item now costs:
Sales tax is 6%. A $50 purchase totals:
A team won 18 of 24 games. What percent did they win?
You save 15% of $200 monthly. How much do you save per year?
A tip of 20% on a $35 meal is:
A car's value dropped 10% from $20,000. New value:
30% of students walk to school. There are 450 students. How many walk?
A recipe calls for 2 cups flour. To make 150%, how many cups?
You scored 45 out of 60. A friend scored 70%. Who did better?

title: Understand Positive and Negative Integers
description: Learn about integers and their positions on a number line

questions.question: Which number is negative?
questions.hint: Negative numbers have a minus sign

questions.question: What is the opposite of 7?
questions.hint: Opposite means same distance from 0 but other side

questions.question: Which is greater: -5 or -2?
questions.hint: -2 is closer to 0, so it's greater

questions.question: What temperature is 5 degrees below zero?
What integer represents 8 floors below ground?
What is the absolute value of -12?
questions.hint: Absolute value is distance from 0 (always positive)

questions.question: Which integer is between -5 and -3?
questions.hint: Look for a number greater than -5 but less than -3

questions.question: A diver is at -30 feet. A fish is at -15 feet. Which is deeper?
questions.hint: -30 is more negative, so deeper underwater

title: Add Integers
description: Add positive and negative numbers

questions.question: What is -4 + (-6)?
questions.hint: Both negative: add and keep negative sign

questions.question: What is 8 + (-8)?
questions.hint: A number plus its opposite equals zero

questions.question: What is -3 + (-9)?
questions.hint: Add the absolute values: 3 + 9 = 12, keep negative

title: Subtract Integers
description: Subtract positive and negative numbers

title: Multiply Integers
description: Multiply positive and negative numbers

title: Divide Integers
description: Divide positive and negative numbers

questions.question: What is 0 ÷ (-12)?
questions.hint: Zero divided by any non-zero number is zero

title: Integer Word Problems
description: Apply integer operations to real-world contexts

questions.question: The temperature was -8°F and rose 15 degrees. What is it now?
A submarine at -200 feet descends 50 more feet. New depth?
You have $45. You spend $60. What is your balance?
An elevator goes from floor -2 to floor 5. How many floors did it travel?
It was -12°C in the morning. By noon it was 3°C. How much did it change?
A company lost $5000 each month for 4 months. Total loss?
A football team gained 8 yards, then lost 12 yards. Net yardage?
The Dead Sea is 430 meters below sea level. Write as integer.
A stock dropped 3 points each day for 6 days. Total change?
The temperature at 6 AM was -5°C. It dropped 8 more degrees. What is it now?

title: Write Algebraic Expressions
description: Translate words into algebraic expressions

questions.question: Write an expression for 'five more than a number n'
Write an expression for 'twice a number x'
Write an expression for 'a number y divided by 4'
questions.hint: 'Divided by' means the number comes first

questions.question: Write an expression for '7 less than a number m'
questions.hint: 'Less than' means subtract from the number

questions.question: Write an expression for 'the product of 3 and p'
Write an expression for 'half of a number h'
Write an expression for '4 times a number k, plus 3'
Write an expression for 'a number w decreased by 9'
Write an expression for 'the sum of a number z and 12'
Write an expression for 'a number t squared'
questions.hint: 'Squared' means raised to the power of 2

questions.question: Write an expression for '6 subtracted from a number r'
questions.hint: 'Subtracted from' means take away from the number

title: Evaluate Expressions
description: Substitute values and calculate expression values

title: Simplify Expressions by Combining Like Terms
description: Combine like terms to simplify algebraic expressions

questions.question: Simplify: 2x + 3y + 5x + y
questions.hint: Combine x terms: 2x + 5x = 7x. Combine y terms: 3y + y = 4y

questions.question: Simplify: 9 + 4p - 2 + p
questions.hint: Combine p terms: 4p + p = 5p. Combine constants: 9 - 2 = 7

questions.question: Simplify: 3x² + 2x²
questions.hint: Like terms have the same variable and exponent

title: Solve One-Step Equations: Addition and Subtraction
description: Solve equations by adding or subtracting

questions.question: Solve: w + (-3) = 10
questions.hint: w + (-3) is the same as w - 3 = 10

title: Solve One-Step Equations: Multiplication and Division
description: Solve equations by multiplying or dividing

title: Solve Two-Step Equations
description: Solve equations requiring two operations

questions.question: Solve: 2x + 5 = 13
questions.hint: First subtract 5: 2x = 8. Then divide by 2: x = 4

title: Write and Solve Equation Word Problems
description: Translate word problems into equations and solve

questions.question: A number plus 8 equals 15. What is the number?
Three times a number is 27. What is the number?
A number divided by 5 is 8. What is the number?
Six less than a number is 10. What is the number?
Twice a number plus 4 equals 18. What is the number?
A book costs $4 more than $12. What is the cost?
Half a number minus 3 is 7. What is the number?
questions.hint: Equation: x/2 - 3 = 7. First: x/2 = 10. Then: x = 20

questions.question: Four times a number, decreased by 5, is 15. What is the number?
The sum of a number and 9 is 24. What is the number?
A number divided by 3, plus 6, equals 10. What is the number?
questions.hint: Equation: x/3 + 6 = 10. First: x/3 = 4. Then: x = 12

title: Understand and Write Inequalities
description: Learn inequality symbols and write inequalities from words

questions.question: What does the symbol < mean?
questions.hint: The symbol points to the smaller value

questions.question: What does the symbol ≥ mean?
questions.hint: The line under means 'or equal to'

questions.question: Write: 'y is at most 10'
questions.hint: 'At most' means less than or equal to

questions.question: Write: 'n is at least 7'
questions.hint: 'At least' means greater than or equal to

questions.question: Write: 'a is less than or equal to 12'
questions.hint: Use ≤ for 'less than or equal to'

questions.question: Which shows 'b is no more than 15'?
questions.hint: 'No more than' means less than or equal to

questions.question: Is x = 5 a solution to x > 3?

title: Solve One-Step Inequalities
description: Solve simple inequalities and graph solutions

questions.question: Which value is NOT a solution to x > 5?
questions.hint: x must be greater than 5, not equal to it

questions.question: Which value IS a solution to n ≤ 8?
questions.hint: n can equal 8 because of the ≤ symbol

title: Inequality Word Problems
description: Write and solve inequalities from real-world situations

questions.question: You need at least $50 for a game. You have $32. How much more do you need?
A bag can hold at most 20 lbs. You have 13 lbs. How much more can you add?
The speed limit is 65 mph. Write an inequality for legal speeds s.
questions.hint: You can drive at or below the limit

questions.question: A ride requires height h > 48 inches. Can someone 48 inches ride?
questions.hint: h must be greater than 48, not equal to it

questions.question: You must be at least 16 to drive. Write the inequality for age a.
questions.hint: 'At least' means greater than or equal to

questions.question: A test needs more than 70 points to pass. What scores pass?
A pool's capacity is no more than 50 people. Write the inequality.
questions.hint: 'No more than' means less than or equal to

questions.question: An elevator holds up to 2000 lbs. 5 people weigh 180 lbs each. How much more weight w is allowed?
A sale item must cost less than $25. Which could be the price?
questions.hint: Price must be less than $25, not equal

questions.question: You have $15 and want to buy notebooks at $3 each. How many n can you buy?
